context_bundle.summary: Psychology research methodology: Experimental (IV/DV, control, randomization), correlational, longitudinal vs cross-sectional, within vs between subjects. Effect sizes (Cohen's d, r), power analysis, replication crisis, preregistration.

onboarding.quick_start: Correlation ≠ causation. Random assignment → causal inference. Effect size matters more than p-value. Power ≥.80. Preregister hypotheses. Replicate.
common_patterns: Experimental: Manipulate IV, measure DV, control confounds, random assignment enables causation
Correlational: Observe relationships, no manipulation, third variable problem, directionality problem
Longitudinal: Same participants over time, tracks change, expensive, attrition issues
Cross-sectional: Different groups at one time, cohort effects confound age effects
known_errors: p-hacking: Multiple comparisons, stopping rules, outcome switching - inflates false positives
Underpowered studies: Small N, large variance = unreliable estimates
WEIRD samples: Western Educated Industrialized Rich Democratic - limits generalizability
Publication bias: Positive results published, file drawer problem distorts literature
